definition: scattered/loose/to come loose/to fall apart/leisurely/powdered medicine
to scatter/to break up (a meeting etc)/to disperse/to disseminate/to dispel/(coll.) to sack
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

sentences.english: The House (ie Members of the House of Commons) rose at 10 pm.
sentences.chinese: 下议院已于晚上10点钟散会。

sentences.english: I asked Baobao, Tiantian and other little friends to come to my party.
sentences.chinese: 我请了宝宝，苦苦战其他小朋友去到场我的死日散会。

sentences.english: The meeting over, we headmaster soon left the meeting-room.
sentences.chinese: 散会了，校长很快就离开了会谈室。

sentences.english: The meeting was so boring that nearly everyone there was watching the clock.
sentences.chinese: 会议很枯燥，差不多人人都看钟希望快点散会。

sentences.english: There being no further business, l declare the meeting closed.
sentences.chinese: 没有再要讨论的事了，我宣布散会。

sentences.english: As the meeting broke up, the participants divided into smaller segments-twos and threes .
sentences.chinese: 散会后，与会者分成三三两两的小组。

sentences.english: He announced thending of the meeting before I could get in a word.
sentences.chinese: 没等我插上一句话，他就宣布散会了。

sentences.english: As soon as the legislature went home, I vetoed the bill.
sentences.chinese: 在州议会散会之后，我立即否决了这个法案。

sentences.english: More diversity reduces amount you can speculate with.
sentences.chinese: 分布过散会减少你能用以投机的数量。

sentences.english: After the meeting, they parted company, never to see each other.
sentences.chinese: 散会后他们分了手，从此再也没有见面。

sentences.english: Thanks for your contributions.  We can finish there.
sentences.chinese: 谢谢各位的意见，我们可以散会了。

sentences.english: The meeting over, our headmaster soon left the meeting room.
sentences.chinese: 散会了，校长很快就离开了会议室。

sentences.english: After the meeting, the people poured out in crowds.
sentences.chinese: 散会后，人们一群一群往外涌。

sentences.english: Let's take a walk after dinner.
sentences.chinese: 让我们晚饭后散会步吧。

sentences.english: There ebeling no further business, l declare the meeting closed.
sentences.chinese: 没有再要讨论的事了，我宣布散会。

definition: to hold a meeting/to attend a meeting
to absent oneself from a meeting/to decline to attend
to say goodbye/to take one's leave
to retire/to withdraw/to retreat/to step down
to whisper and chat (instead of listening during a meeting or lecture)
to go home (in a ceremonial procession)/to return home
(coll.) to beat it/to take French leave
